content:
Curious if anyone knows about anything like this for backdrop, either in production or in development:
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/node-field-classes

There's an early port of the Display Suite module here: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ds

backdrop-contrib/ds
Contribute to backdrop-contrib/ds development by creating an account on GitHub.
I doubt if the functionality is operational, but maybe some poking of the maintainer might get the functionality you're looking for. :slight_smile:
I have responded in the forum post @Kristin :wink:

@Kristin Another option may be to port https://www.drupal.org/project/field_formatter_class. On first sight, it doesn't look very complex. (Note: The D7 version depends on Field Formatter Settings which has been added in Backdrop core.)

I would also be open to wrapping this functionality into Field Wrappers. I'm guessing adding a bunch of these formatters might potentially conflict with one another so getting them in the same module might be helpful.

I would also be open to wrapping this functionality into Field Wrappers.

Wonderful! Was about to ask it but didn't had the heart.

@Olaf Grabienski @Kristin I've just made a commit that merges Field Formatter Class functionality into Field Wrappers. If one or both of you can test, I'll make a new release.
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/field_wrappers/issues/6

Add ability to add a class to the outer wrapper 路 Issue #6 路 backdrop-contrib/field_wrappers
Per a Zulip conversation, it would be nice to be able to specify a class for the outer wrapper.
@Laryn Sure, happy to test the commit, probably tomorrow (it's late here now).
